title: Auguste Comte
summary: Isidore Marie Auguste François Xavier Comte (French: [o'ɡyst kɔ̃t] (listen); 19 January 1798 – 5 September 1857)[5] was a French philosopher and writer who formulated the doctrine of positivism. He is often regarded as the first philosopher of science in the modern sense of the term.[6] Comte's ideas were also fundamental to the development of sociology; indeed, he invented the term and treated that discipline as the crowning achievement of the sciences.[7]
